message: I named it London since it was originally for organising a meet-up. But maybe it'd make more sense for this group just to be 'real-time web' - lose the 'London'?
It depends what the group is for. Is it for the meetup, or for something bigger?
I'm from Bournemouth, I don't mind either way ;)
it was for the meetup - but it seems odd to limit the online group to a location
If there is a chance that this group will be used for meetups and topics outside of London, then remove the London bit. :)
Yeah agree Real-time web sounds broader, although the heritage of using 'London' in the name sometimes helps
I don't think it's specific to the web
my idea for the group was to discuss tech and projects related to real-time web, not concentrating on node specifically, although it seems a popular choice right now.
Saying it's real-time web is a bit insidious because I know tons of companies using Node, Tornade and WebSockets internally for very bespoke apps
also, is it likely that the london javascript meetup discusses node? the python group discusses tornado etc. ?
